Donald Rumsfeld quickly prodded military leaders on the subject. Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives, including former House Republican Majority Leader Dick Armey and former Dick Armey Jim Ryun , to convince him to run for president rather than Indiana governor. For them, the Hoosier checks many boxes- a fresh face on the national scene, a charismatic speaker from the heartland and, most important, a Republican who can appeal to all three elements of the party base: social conservatives, economic conservatives and foreign policy conservatives, the story said. of examples: â¢ The Debt Ceiling. The deficit and the debt are real issues, but the "debt ceiling" debate is political posturing. Professor Hamilton recently wrote: Debt ceiling politics If you have a concrete proposal to raise tax revenue or cut spending, then put it on the table. But if you simply want to grandstand on the debt ceiling as if it were a stand-alone issue, it is clear that you have nothing but contempt for the voters. â¢ A recent article on NY Times about "discussions" on state bankruptcies.
